                  double angle)
        Write text centered a the robot's current position.
        Parameters:

        angle - the angle in degrees that the text is rotated counterclockwise.

      • print

        public void print​(double x,
                  double y,
                  java.lang.String text,
                  double angle)
        Write text on the screen.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the center of the text.
        y - the y coordinate of the center of the text.
        text - message to be written on the screen.
        angle - the angle in degrees that the text is rotated counterclockwise.

      • goTo

        public void goTo​(double x,
                 double y)
        Moves the robot to a specified position. This will result in a line being drawn if the tail is down.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate.
        y - y coordinate.

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle​(double angle)
        Rotates the robot to a specified heading. (0 is right. 90 is up.)
        Parameters:
        angle - heading in degrees.

      • goHome

        public void goHome()
        Returns the robot to position (0,0) with a heading of 0 degrees.

      • delay

        Pauses the program.
        Parameters:
        t - pause in milliseconds

      • setPenColor

        public void setPenColor​(java.lang.String color)
        Sets the color that the robot draws with.
        Parameters:
        color - name of a color or a 6-digit hex color string (e.g. "00FF00" for green)

      • setPenColor

        public void setPenColor​(int red,
                        int green,
                        int blue)
        Sets the color that the robot draws with, allows custom colors.
        Parameters:
        red - red as value between 0 - 255
        green - green as value between 0 - 255
        blue - blue as value between 0 - 255

      • setPenColor

        public void setPenColor​(int red,
                        int green,
                        int blue,
                        int alpha)
        Sets the color that the robot draws with, allows custom colors with alpha channel.
        Parameters:
        red - red as value between 0 - 255
        green - green as value between 0 - 255
        blue - blue as value between 0 - 255
        alpha - alpha as value between 0 - 255

      • setOpacity

        public void setOpacity​(int alpha)
        Sets the opacity of the color that the robot draws with.
        Parameters:
        alpha - alpha value between 0 - 255 to set as opacity of new pen color

      • penSize

        public void penSize​(double size)
        Sets the line width that the robot draws.
        Parameters:
        size - line width in pixels

        public double getAngle()
        Gets the angle .
        Returns:

      • getAngleTo

        public double getAngleTo​(double x,
                         double y)
        Gets the angle if the robot was facing the specified position. (0 is right. 90 is up.)
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Returns:
        the angle to an specified position.

      • worldCoordinates

        public void worldCoordinates​(double minx,
                             double miny,
                             double maxx,
                             double maxy)
        Sets the what robot position will be at the bottom-left and the top-right of the screen.
        Parameters:
        minx - x coordinate of the left side of the screen.
        miny - y coordinate of the bottom of the screen.
        maxx - x coordinate of the right side of the screen.
        maxy - y coordinate of the top of the screen.

      • save

        public void save​(java.lang.String filename)
        Saves the screen to a PNG image.
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename of the image excluding the extension. (e.g. "myImage" instead of "myImage.PNG")

      • turnOff

        public void turnOff()
        Closes and exits the program.

      • interactiveMode

        public void interactiveMode​(boolean onOff)
        Allows the user to type what they want the robot to do while the robot window is up.
        Parameters:
        onOff - - interactive mode switch (on, if true; false, otherwise)
